page.title: 17NEW BY PASS IN BLAYDON BURN.
page.content: In Blaydon Burn the building of a new by pass is in progress. The road is being built for two purposes, one to take the quarry heavy goods traffic away from the narrow Summer Hill Bank, and secondly as part of the Ryton_Crawcrook by pass. The road was designed by the County Council engineers, and is being built by Balfour Beatty, at a cost of 1.4 million pounds. Their contract started in June 1984 and expires in September 1985.On the site at the moment is a labour force of three steel-fixers, four joiners and one chief engineer. A bridge across the Burn will soon be built. It will be 14m high and 63m long. At the moment 10 men are at work on the bridge, which in June 1985 is just a mass of scaffold. On the bridge is a big N.C.K. Rapier crane.
